Color - Class in com.l8smartlight.sdk.core
The Color class is used to encapsulate colors in the default sRGB color space or colors in arbitrary color spaces identified by a ColorSpace.
Color(int, int, int) - Constructor for class com.l8smartlight.sdk.core.Color
Creates an opaque sRGB color with the specified red, green, and blue values in the range (0 - 255).
Color(int, int, int, int) - Constructor for class com.l8smartlight.sdk.core.Color
Creates an sRGB color with the specified red, green, blue, and alpha values in the range (0 - 255).
Color(int) - Constructor for class com.l8smartlight.sdk.core.Color
Creates an opaque sRGB color with the specified combined RGB value consisting of the red component in bits 16-23, the green component in bits 8-15, and the blue component in bits 0-7.
Color(int, boolean) - Constructor for class com.l8smartlight.sdk.core.Color
Creates an sRGB color with the specified combined RGBA value consisting of the alpha component in bits 24-31, the red component in bits 16-23, the green component in bits 8-15, and the blue component in bits 0-7.
Color(float, float, float) - Constructor for class com.l8smartlight.sdk.core.Color
Creates an opaque sRGB color with the specified red, green, and blue values in the range (0.0 - 1.0).
Color(float, float, float, float) - Constructor for class com.l8smartlight.sdk.core.Color
Creates an sRGB color with the specified red, green, blue, and alpha values in the range (0.0 - 1.0).
